title: KTM 390 Duke and Triumph 400s now available with 10-year warranty
description: Bajaj is offering a standard 10 year warranty on the KTM 390 Duke and the full Triumph 400cc lineup, free-of-cost but this is valid only if you purchase any of these machines till June 30.  Triumph and KTM largely share the same engine This offer is valid until June 30 KTM and Triumph’s operations in India are managed by Bajaj Triumph has a total of four motorcycles in its 400cc portfolio Bajaj has rolled out a special offer for anyone purchasing either a KTM 390 Duke or one of the Triumph 400s. In addition to the standard 5-year warranty, Bajaj is offering an additional 5 years of coverage at no extra cost. This offer is valid until 30th June. At present, in the KTM lineup, the offer is only available for the 390 Duke. However, it extends across Triumph’s entire 400cc lineup, which includes the Speed T4, Speed 400, Scrambler 400 X, and the recently launched Scrambler 400 XC.  The 399cc engine produces 46hp and 39Nm in the KTM, whereas the Triumph’s are available in two-states-of-tune. In the Speed 400 and Scrambler 400, it produces 40hp and 37.5Nm, whereas, in the more affordable Speed T4, it churns out 31hp and 36Nm. Also see: Triumph Scrambler 400 X review: Bigger differences
author: Ved Janve

This 10 year warranty is available only if you purchase any of these bikes till June 30.

Bajaj is offering a standard 10 year warranty on the KTM 390 Duke and the full Triumph 400cc lineup, free-of-cost but this is valid only if you purchase any of these machines till June 30. 

  1. Triumph and KTM largely share the same engine
  2. This offer is valid until June 30

KTM and Triumph’s operations in India are managed by Bajaj

Triumph has a total of four motorcycles in its 400cc portfolio

Bajaj has rolled out a special offer for anyone purchasing either a KTM 390 Duke or one of the Triumph 400s. In addition to the standard 5-year warranty, Bajaj is offering an additional 5 years of coverage at no extra cost. This offer is valid until 30th June.

At present, in the KTM lineup, the offer is only available for the 390 Duke. However, it extends across Triumph’s entire 400cc lineup, which includes the Speed T4, Speed 400, Scrambler 400 X, and the recently launched Scrambler 400 XC. 

The 399cc engine produces 46hp and 39Nm in the KTM, whereas the Triumph’s are available in two-states-of-tune. In the Speed 400 and Scrambler 400, it produces 40hp and 37.5Nm, whereas, in the more affordable Speed T4, it churns out 31hp and 36Nm.
